intro: Eutoca divaricata, commonly known as the variable eutoca, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Eutoca divaricata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
